body:
That'll work... The code is fine. We recently upped our warning levels and
I think we are going through a bit of a shake out with different compilers.
This one I fixed as part of another change and so it should be right at
head soon. Which compiler and version are you using so we can prioritize it
for our CI servers?

On Thu, Sep 24, 2015, 6:45 AM martin-pc notifications@github.com wrote:

> When I follow the standard steps:
> git clone https://github.com/grpc/grpc.git
> cd grpc
> git submodule update --init
> make
> 
> I get the following message:
> #####################################################################
> In file included from src/core/transport/chttp2/frame_data.c:41:0:
> src/core/transport/chttp2/frame_data.c: In function
> ‘grpc_chttp2_data_parser_parse’:
> src/core/transport/chttp2/frame_data.c:164:30: error: comparison between
> signed and unsigned integer expressions [-Werror=sign-compare]
> GPR_ASSERT(end - cur <= p->frame_size);
> ^
> include/grpc/support/log.h:98:11: note: in definition of macro ‘GPR_ASSERT’
> if (!(x)) { \
> ^
> cc1: all warnings being treated as errors
> make: ***
> [/home/martin/grpc/objs/opt/src/core/transport/chttp2/frame_data.o] Error 1
> #####################################################################
> I could remove the -Werror flag in the makefile, but I am unsure if this
> solves the actual problem!
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/grpc/grpc/issues/3455.

gcc --version
gcc (Ubuntu 4.8.1-2ubuntu1~12.04) 4.8.1

Same problem with gcc 4.6

The last checkin to grpc seem to be:
git log

commit ee56eb60c8aa0e36ac33b00fbd4e70a61412d2e4
Merge: e5515d4 d09cce1
Author: Craig Tiller ctiller@google.com
Date:   Wed Sep 23 16:22:43 2015 -0700

```
Merge pull request #3444 from dgquintas/lb_policies_test

Improvements to lb_policies_test's rebirth testcase.
```

Okay, now I get a new error when I run the make command:

[HOSTCXX] Compiling src/compiler/cpp_plugin.cc
